repnme.cdata!: Ukraine - Lviv Water and Wastewater Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Lviv Water and
            Wastewater Project in Ukraine were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was also satisfactory. Lessons learned included:
            it is important for the Bank to carefully assess the merits
            of its demands on the Borrower when there are clear signs of
            resistance. In the particular case of the Bank's
            insistence that the Lviv Vodokanal employ a foreign, private
            management operator it was obvious that the Client did not
            favor such a solution. The subsequent substitute of a
            management contract by expensive, foreign management
            advisory services was not well advised either given the
            explicit, strong reluctance of the Borrower to employ a
            management operator. In middle-income countries where the
            development of Bank business is not assured the Bank would
            benefit from being closely attuned to the demands and
            preferences of prospective borrowers. By the same token, the
            Bank might wish to consider longer-term client relationships
            as afforded by follow-up operations since it is highly
            unlikely that reforms will be possible to define, let alone
            implement, under one isolated operation. The choice of
            performance indicators and the level of technical, economic
            and financial analysis should be guided by the quality of
            baseline data. In the particular case of water supply and
            wastewater projects the quality of production and
            consumption data is suspect in the absence of widespread and
            careful metering. In the case of the technical analysis such
            uncertainties in data argue in favor of flexible and robust
            project designs as in rehabilitation projects. In the case
            of economic analysis may be sufficient to concentrate on
            flexible least-cost analysis rather than engage in economic
            cost-benefit analysis where the results could well be
            spurious when the baseline data are of poor quality and
            subject to considerable change.

repnme.cdata!: Ukraine - Lviv Water and Wastewater Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Lviv Water and Wastewater Project
            aims to improve the efficiency of Lviv Water and Wastewater
            Company's (LVK) technical, commercial, and financial
            operations through a management and operations improvement
            advisory services contract, and enhance LVK's financial
            capacity through reducing operating costs, better justified
            investment selection, progressive full-cost recovery
            policies, and effective consumer-oriented commercial
            practices. There are six components in the project. 1) The
            water supply - initial defined investments component will
            finance rehabilitation of pumping stations, establishment of
            pressure zones, replacement of pipelines, and purchase of
            repair and construction equipment. 2) The wastewater
            component will rehabilitate Wastewater Treatment Plants 1
            and 2 , and replace pumping units at the main pumping
            station of the wastewater treatment facility. 3) The
            Operating Fund component will finance investments as well as
            institutional strengthening and other expenditures
            identified as needed. 4) The institutional strengthening
            component will finance management and advisory operations
            improvement advisory services, and incremental expenses of
            the implementation.ntation unit. 5) The engineering and
            construction supervision services component will support
            engineering services and construction supervision services
            of various components of the project. 6) The auditors'
            fees component will cover the costs of engagement of
            external auditors during implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Ukraine - Lviv Water and Wastewater Project
            : environmental management plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The Lviv Water and Wastewater Project
            will comprise a) water distribution network pipe
            replacement, and b) rehabilitation of existing pumping
            stations and specific components of the water production and
            wastewater treatment facilities. Since all works involve
            rehabilitation only, the project will not entail any
            resettlement. The adverse environmental impact will mainly
            be related to construction work. Mitigation measures will be
            applied when required. During construction, noise will be
            minimized through scheduling and applying specific
            restrictions for particularly noisy activities. Dust
            suppression measures will be used to protect air quality.
            Traffic routing will be used to reduce vehicle emissions.
            Demolition and excavation debris will be removed and
            disposed of at an approved location. Water treatment sludge
            will be collected and buried in accordance with the existing
            Ukrainian construction standard. All aboveground storage
            tanks and drums will be stored on low permeability bases
            which are capable of containing 110 percent of the stored
            volume. All vegetation destroyed will be replaced. A
            monitoring system will be established for the wastewater
            treatment plants and Poltva River.
